meanings.definition: A person who habitually avoids paying for their own expenses by imposing on others.
meanings.sent1: The sorner always expects others to cover the bill when they go out.
meanings.sent2: My cousin is a sorner who never offers to contribute when we eat together.
meanings.sent3: The sorner tried to get a free meal by pretending to forget their wallet.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the sorner at the party, they will find a way to avoid paying their share.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sorner sneaking away without paying stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To obtain something by imposing on others or by begging.
meanings.sent1: He tried to sorner some snacks from his friend during the movie.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to sorner a ride home from work when it's raining.
meanings.sent3: The cat would sorner attention by meowing loudly at the door.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to sorner votes by promising unrealistic changes.
meanings.sent5: The child would sorner hugs from everyone in the room.

meanings.sent1: The scammer would sorner money from unsuspecting victims online.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty after trying to sorner her sister out of her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The magician would sorner applause by using hidden tricks in his act.
meanings.sent4: The con artist would sorner trust before taking advantage of his targets.
meanings.sent5: The thief would sorner valuables from unlocked cars in the neighborhood.
